content.rendered:
Overview

Slack was recently aquired by Salesforce as a fantastic new collaboration tool for their CRM. Not long after the finalization, Marc Benioff announced that they would be updating Salesforce to be a Slack first application. As a long time remote worker, (and huge fan of Slack 😉) I couldn’t be more excited about this new chapter in CRM and collaboration. I have found Slack to be an amazing resource for my teams, company and self for collaboration and project management. With Slack I have never felt more connected to my teams. I no longer feel like I am on an island alone.

To learn more about the exciting step forward for Slack, Salesforce, and resources. You can check out the document on Quip. Included in the document are Slack training resources, Trailhead modules and projects, Partner Learning Camp modules, articles, & more.

Document Details

One highlight of this document is how to implement Slack at your company if not already using it. You’ll find it tips, tricks, and recommendations for Slack. In addition, you’ll learn how Slack can help you and your company become more collaborative/connected across the board.

As Trailhead and the Partner Learning Camp continue to add more modules and projects, be it how to build or manage projects, or how to administer the application, this document will be updated. You’ll also find a link to the trails that are overall collections of those different modules and projects.

For those of you unfamiliar with the Partner Learning Camp, it is a resource that is similar to Trailhead for partners. The PLC not only covers the how to on the platform, but project management, design, and resources for your Salesforce projects. All you need to access the Partner Learning Camp is a partners.salesforce.com login. If you have questions about how to use the Partner Learning Camp, feel free to reach out to me. I’m happy to share, help and assist you with access and use. Within the Partner Learning Camp, you’ll also find ways to set up your projects. As well as ways to administer day to day, templates for getting up organized, and more.

Resources

Feel free to share this document out, as it is a public document and jumped in to learn more about Slack and how you can run your Slack projects and ensure that your place of work has top notch Slack-ers.

https://quip.com/zyjZA1pq9y9K/Slack-Welcome-to-the-Family-Slack-Resources

jetpack-related-posts.title: Salesforce #OhanaSlack
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Salesforce #OhanaSlack is a Slack Workspace that's available to connect with theSalesforce community and get real time help 24/7.

jetpack-related-posts.title: DF19 OhanaSlack Ice Cream Social
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Dreamforce 19 was amazing, wasn't it? So much fun seeing so many Ohana, all the awesome sessions, cool announcements, Obama!!! But this year at Dreamforce, I was able to do something a little extra special, and decided to try to bring some Ohana together myself. Knew before that planning things for…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Dreamforce 18 – The Thursday of Presentations
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: This Dreamforce was c-razy!! Not only was it my first Dreamforce as an MVP, but it was also the Dreamforce of back to back action for me. Here's a bit about my #DF18 adventure...

jetpack-related-posts.title: Salesforce CRM CMS
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: We've talked CMS Connect, Native CMS, now hear all about Salesforce CRM CMS and the wins you get using it in your community!

jetpack-related-posts.title: Native CMS
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Out of the box you you have 3 types of CMS, native CMS is one of those 3. Learn all about it from how to create articles, use cases, and why use Native CMS.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Salesforce Events 2020
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: The Salesforce Events 2020 is live!! That's right Ohana, it wouldn't be my blog if I wasn't talking about events and how we connect and get together as humans.  For real, we get out from behind the keyboard, and even leave the HOUSE!!! I know, it's crazy, but for Ohana,…
